articles.headline: Fake Reviews Are Rampant Online. Can a Crackdown End Them?
articles.snippet: A wave of regulation and industry action has placed the flourishing fake review business on notice. But experts say the problem may be insurmountable.
articles.abstract: A wave of regulation and industry action has placed the flourishing fake review business on notice. But experts say the problem may be insurmountable.
articles.lead_paragraph: After Dr. Mark J. Mohrmann completed a successful orthopedic procedure in 2019, his patient turned to Yelp, the review website, to share his appreciation.

articles.headline: Rashida Tlaib, Censured by the House, Is Praised and Condemned at Home
articles.snippet: The Democratic congresswoman from the Detroit area and the only Palestinian American in the House faces a complicated landscape in her district.
articles.abstract: The Democratic congresswoman from the Detroit area and the only Palestinian American in the House faces a complicated landscape in her district.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a month, the suburbs of Detroit have played host to vigils where victims of the war between Israel and Hamas are commemorated with prayers, candles and tearful speeches.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Adopts Ethics Code After Reports of Undisclosed Gifts and Travel
articles.snippet: The code does not specify how the rules would be enforced or by whom.
articles.abstract: The code does not specify how the rules would be enforced or by whom.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court issued an ethics code on Monday after a series of revelations about undisclosed property deals and gifts intensified pressure on the justices to adopt one.
articles.byline: By Abbie VanSickle and Adam Liptak

articles.headline: Death and Despair at Gaza Hospital as Fighting Reaches Its Doors
articles.snippet: “I’m watching patients die in front of my eyes,” one doctor at a besieged hospital said, “and I can’t provide them the slightest bit of help.” Israel said its forces were targeting Hamas fighters.
articles.abstract: “I’m watching patients die in front of my eyes,” one doctor at a besieged hospital said, “and I can’t provide them the slightest bit of help.” Israel said its forces were targeting Hamas fighters.
articles.lead_paragraph: With Israel’s ground war in the Gaza Strip in its third week, Israeli military vehicles on Monday arrived at the gates of a besieged hospital complex where fuel, medicine and food are running out. Inside the hospital, the nursing staff were moving 36 premature babies to the only department that still had oxygen.
articles.byline: By Hiba Yazbek, Ameera Harouda and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: The Rise and Fall of the World’s Most Successful Joint Venture
articles.snippet: China and the U.S. both gained from their economic integration. As they pull apart, each is finding it will be hard to fully replace the other.
articles.abstract: China and the U.S. both gained from their economic integration. As they pull apart, each is finding it will be hard to fully replace the other.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a quarter century, the fortunes of the United States and China were fused in a uniquely monumental joint venture.

articles.headline: Google’s C.E.O. Takes Another Turn on the Antitrust Witness Stand
articles.snippet: Sundar Pichai, Google’s chief executive, testified on Tuesday for the second time in two weeks to defend his company against monopoly claims.
articles.abstract: Sundar Pichai, Google’s chief executive, testified on Tuesday for the second time in two weeks to defend his company against monopoly claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, Google had a big day in Washington. President Biden signed an executive order to create artificial intelligence safeguards that could affect Google’s most pressing projects, and Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken gave the company an award for its work in aiding Ukrainian refugees and promoting women’s economic security.

articles.headline: U.S. Manages Expectations of a Breakthrough Before Biden and Xi Meet
articles.snippet: President Biden and President Xi Jinping of China will try to defuse a year of bubbling tensions on Wednesday at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
articles.abstract: President Biden and President Xi Jinping of China will try to defuse a year of bubbling tensions on Wednesday at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
articles.lead_paragraph: Of all the issues dividing the United States and China — spy balloons, Beijing’s rapid nuclear buildup and Washington’s crackdown on advanced computer chips — the White House has been engaged in one more topic of debate: what China’s leader will see when he looks out of his window during his visit to California this week.
articles.byline: By Katie Rogers and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Sharp Drop in Airfares Cheers Inflation-Weary Travelers
articles.snippet: Airlines are starting to offer bargain prices, including to popular overseas destinations like Paris, a sign that they are fighting to fill planes.
articles.abstract: Airlines are starting to offer bargain prices, including to popular overseas destinations like Paris, a sign that they are fighting to fill planes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Airfares to many popular destinations have recently fallen to their lowest levels in months, and even holiday travel is far cheaper than it was last year, providing some welcome relief to consumers who have been frustrated for months by high prices for all manner of goods and services.

articles.headline: House Passes Johnson’s Plan to Avert Shutdown in Bipartisan Vote
articles.snippet: With many Republicans refusing to back more government spending, Democrats supplied the bulk of the votes for the speaker’s bill to extend federal funding through early 2024.
articles.abstract: With many Republicans refusing to back more government spending, Democrats supplied the bulk of the votes for the speaker’s bill to extend federal funding through early 2024.
articles.lead_paragraph: Speaker Mike Johnson was forced on Tuesday to rely on Democratic votes as the House passed legislation to keep federal funding flowing into early 2024, after scores of Republicans opposed his plan to avert a government shutdown at the end of the week.
